title: How to Make Vegetable Pie

steps.headline: Gather your utensils & prepare your ingredients.
Prepare the pastry.
steps.description: In a food processor or other mixing bowl, combine butter and flour until blended, it should resemble fine crumbs. Add sour cream and pulse until combined. If necessary, add cold water 1 teaspoon at a time and pulse until it starts to form clumps of dough. Put aside in the fridge while you prepare your other ingredients.

steps.headline: Heat a large frying pan with a little oil or butter.
steps.description: Fry the carrots, onions and celery until golden brown. Add garlic and sweet potato with 1/2 cup of water. cover and simmer for 5 minutes. You may make the sauce during this time. Add zucchini and stir through, cook until vegetables are just tender. Take off the heat.

steps.headline: Make the sauce.
steps.description: Heat the butter and once melted, add the flour and optional spice seasonings if desired, Once combined, add the milk in batches, whisking over low heat until thick and smooth to the taste. Check for salt & pepper and add as required.

steps.headline: Combine sauce and vegetables.
steps.description: Add remaining peas and herbs if desired as these ingredients need minimal cooking. Place filling into the pie dish, casserole or individual serving dishes.

steps.headline: Roll out pastry thinly (approx 5mm or 1/5 of an inch) and top baking dish/s.
steps.description: Brush with milk or beaten egg if desired for a nice glaze.

steps.headline: Bake at 180C / 350F until pastry is golden and filling is warmed through.

tyn: Knife, vegetable peeler, chopping board, measuring utensils.
Large pan or frying pan and wooden spoon
Pie dish (to hold at least 2 liters)
text: Gather your utensils & prepare your ingredients.  Prepare the pastry. In a food processor or other mixing bowl, combine butter and flour until blended, it should resemble fine crumbs. Add sour cream and pulse until combined. If necessary, add cold water 1 teaspoon at a time and pulse until it starts to form clumps of dough. Put aside in the fridge while you prepare your other ingredients. Heat a large frying pan with a little oil or butter. Fry the carrots, onions and celery until golden brown. Add garlic and sweet potato with 1/2 cup of water. cover and simmer for 5 minutes. You may make the sauce during this time. Add zucchini and stir through, cook until vegetables are just tender. Take off the heat. Make the sauce. Heat the butter and once melted, add the flour and optional spice seasonings if desired, Once combined, add the milk in batches, whisking over low heat until thick and smooth to the taste. Check for salt & pepper and add as required. Combine sauce and vegetables. Add remaining peas and herbs if desired as these ingredients need minimal cooking. Place filling into the pie dish, casserole or individual serving dishes. Roll out pastry thinly (approx 5mm or 1/5 of an inch) and top baking dish/s. Brush with milk or beaten egg if desired for a nice glaze. Bake at 180C / 350F until pastry is golden and filling is warmed through. This is usually about 20-25 minutes. Finished.
sentences: Gather your utensils & prepare your ingredients.
Prepare the pastry.
In a food processor or other mixing bowl, combine butter and flour until blended, it should resemble fine crumbs.
Add sour cream and pulse until combined.
If necessary, add cold water 1 teaspoon at a time and pulse until it starts to form clumps of dough.
Put aside in the fridge while you prepare your other ingredients.
Heat a large frying pan with a little oil or butter.
Fry the carrots, onions and celery until golden brown.
Add garlic and sweet potato with 1/2 cup of water.
cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
You may make the sauce during this time.
Add zucchini and stir through, cook until vegetables are just tender.
Take off the heat.
Make the sauce.
Heat the butter and once melted, add the flour and optional spice seasonings if desired, Once combined, add the milk in batches, whisking over low heat until thick and smooth to the taste.
Check for salt & pepper and add as required.
Combine sauce and vegetables.
Add remaining peas and herbs if desired as these ingredients need minimal cooking.
Place filling into the pie dish, casserole or individual serving dishes.
Roll out pastry thinly (approx 5mm or 1/5 of an inch) and top baking dish/s.
Brush with milk or beaten egg if desired for a nice glaze.
Bake at 180C / 350F until pastry is golden and filling is warmed through.
This is usually about 20-25 minutes.
Finished.
